Articles.Content:
I wish there was an explanation of how each of the parts are intended to be used.  For most parts it fairly obvious.  For some it's definitely not obvious.

For example: The RTC "Rottweiler" Truck Chassis.  I get that it's a chassis.  Which you would think would make it a straight forward part to use to build a rover.  But, a few things make it immediately confusing.

Starting from an empty VAB, when you click the rottweiler to be your initial part, it's initial orientation has it on it's side edge with the top facing forward.  Unless this is actually how it's intended to be oriented in a completed craft.

There are other examples, this is just the one that really jumps out at me.

The VAB gets its orientation from the pod part you are intended to place first. This is a problem if you place a part other than a pod because it appears to default to vertical. To workaround place an aircraft pod, then your starter part, then remove the aircraft pod.
